titleStmt.title: SII 7.477: original edition by K.V. Subrahmanya Aiyer
No. 477. (A.R. No. 262 of 1901). ON THE WEST WALL OF THE CENTRAL SHRINE IN THE KODANDARAMA-PERUMAL TEMPLE AT MADURANTAKAM, SAME TALUK AND DISTRICT.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)
Conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
svasti śrī . pūmevuvaḷar tiruppoṉ mārvu puṇara nāmevu kalaimakaḷ nalamperituñ ciṟappa vijaiyamāmakaḷ velpuyat tiruppa Icaiyiṉ celviyum Eṇṭicai viḷaṅka nirupar vantiṟaiñca niṇila maṭantaiyait tirumaṇam puṇarntu cirvaḷartaru maṇimuṭi kavitteṉa ma
ṇimuṭi cūṭi mallaiñālattup palluyirkkellām Ellaiyi liṉpam Iyalvinil leyta veṇkuṭai niḻaṟṟa ceṅko locci vāḻipallūḻi yāḻi naṭappa cempoṉ virasiṁhāsaṉattup puvaṉamuḻutuṭaiyāḷoṭum viṟṟiruntaruḷiya kovirājakecaripanmarāṉatripuva
ṉaśakravattikaḷ śrīkulottuṅkacoḻatevarkku yāṇṭu 3ṟā Āvattu jayaṅkoṇṭacoḻamaṇṭalattuk kaḷattūrkkoṭṭattut taniyūr śrīmaturāntakaccaruppetimaṅkalattu yāḷuṅkaṇattāruḷ śrīparakesariccerik kuṇṭur Ejña ntapaṭṭaṉ makaṉ sarvvadevapaṭ
ṭanneṉ Ivvūrt tiruvaiyortti karuṇākarapperumāḷukku tirununtāviḷakkukkum santiviḷakkukkum Āka viṭṭa kamukamtoṭṭamāvatu Ivvūr· t talaippāṭakam viracoḻavāykkālukku vaṭakku Añcāṅ kaṇṇāṟṟu viranāraāyaṉavatikkukk kiḻakku Iraṇṭāñ caturattut teṟkil Eṭṭil kaṭaittalai melai neṭumpāṭa
kattil vaṭakkaṭaiya En pitāvinpakkal kūṟu peṟṟu Ennutāy varukiṟa pāṭakam kāl Ikkāl pāṭakamum tirununtāviḷakkum santiviḷakkum santirātittavaṟ cellakkaṭavatāka viṭṭup piramāṇañ ceytukuṭutten kuṇṭur sarvvadevapaṭṭanen Ivar paṇikka Eḻutinen Ivvūr karaṇattān collāmaṟccuṭṭānen I
vai Eḻuttu Ivai kuṇṭur sarvvadevapaṭṭan Eḻuttu Ippaṭi Aṟiveṉ kuñcampavvil cirāmapaṭṭasomayājiyeṉ Ippaṭi Aṟiveṉ viṣṇupaṭṭaṉen Ippaṭi Aṟiveṉ Araṇaippuṟattu Ejñamurttipaṭṭasomaiyājiyeṉ Ippaṭi Aṟiveṉ karumāṇikkapaṭṭaṉen . Ittirunuṉtāviḷakku Iṟakkūvā
r māhāsabhaiyār Āṇai tiruvāṇai .
Digital edition of SII 7.477 by converted to DHARMA conventions by Dorotea Operato.
